intro: Malvastrum riparium, commonly known as the river mallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows along riverbanks and wetlands, thriving in moist, sandy or loamy soils. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a soft, velvety texture and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late summer. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Malvastrum riparium is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
